assetsRedirects.description: Avoid doing redirects, it will kill your web page on mobile.
assetsRedirects.title: Avoid doing redirects

cacheHeaders.description: Cache responses longer than one 1 month is good.
cacheHeaders.title: Avoid extra requests by setting a cache headers

combineCss.advice: Using an HTTP/2 or SPDY connection should not be hurt by serving many CSS from the same domain ... but be careful! Many CSS requests on page can still make the load slow, so check how they are prioritized. It could be that you should combine at least a few of them.
combineCss.description: The more number of CSS requests, the slower the page will be. Combine your CSS files into one. If you are using HTTP/1
combineCss.title: Combine CSS files if HTTP/1

combineJs.advice: Using an HTTP/2 or SPDY connection should not be hurt by serving many JavaScript from the same domain ... but be careful! Many JavaScript request on the page can still make the page slow, so check how they are prioritized. It could be that you should combine at least a few of them.
combineJs.description: The more number of JavaScript requests, the slower the page will be. Combine your JS files into one. If you are using HTTP/1
combineJs.title: Combine JS files if HTTP/1

compressAssets.description: Send content compressed over the wire to save bytes
compressAssets.title: Always compress text content

connectionKeepAlive.description: Use keep alive headers & don't close the connection when we have multiple requests to one and the same domain
connectionKeepAlive.title: Don't close a connection that is used multiple times

cssSize.title: Total CSS size shouldn't be too big

documentRedirect.description: You should never ever redirect the main document.
documentRedirect.title: Avoid redirect the main document

favicon.title: The favicon should be small and cacheable

fewFonts.description: Fonts can slow down the rendering of content try to avoid too many of them
fewFonts.title: Avoid too many fonts

fewRequestsPerDomain.advice: There are almost no limits on HTTP/2 connections with the number of requests, but it is not completely true. It depends on how parts of them are downloaded. Please check you HAR file, does it look OK?
fewRequestsPerDomain.description: Using HTTP/1 browsers has a limit of number of concurrent requests per domain, so limit the amount.
fewRequestsPerDomain.title: Avoid too many requests per domain

headerSize.title: Response headers shouldn't be too big

imageSize.title: Total image size shouldn't be too big

javascriptSize.title: Total JavaScript size shouldn't be too big

pageSize.description: Avoid having pages that have transfer size over the wire more than 2mb because that is really big and will hurt performance.
pageSize.title: Total page size shouldn't be too big

privateAssets.description: Static content should be able to be cached & used by everyone.
privateAssets.title: Don't use private headers on static content

responseOk.description: Check for 40X and 50X responses, and report them.
responseOk.title: Avoid missing and error requests

assetsRedirects.title: Avoid doing redirects

cacheHeaders.title: Avoid extra requests by setting a cache headers
